title: Wronged boyfriend 'distraught' by pictures and messages found on his partner's daughter's iPad
text:
Wronged boyfriend 'distraught' by pictures and messages found on his partner's daughter's iPad Because his girlfriend isn't particularly "tech savvy", the evidence was easy to find Share The discovery has sent him reeling (Photo: Getty) Share Get daily   
If you found out you were being taken for a fool by your partner , what would you do? 
Would you pack your bags and leave without saying a word, or would you confront them and let them know how you felt? 
This is the conundrum facing one heartbroken man, after he made an unpleasant discovery on his girlfriend's daughter's iPad. 
By his own admission, his partner isn't particularly "tech savvy" - and it's precisely this which lead him to find out their relationship was not what he thought it was. "I wasn't snooping..." 
The man, known as Katash, has been living with the knowledge that his girlfriend has been 'sexting' her ex-boyfriend for four weeks. The messages popped up on his girlfriend's daughter's iPad (Photo: PA) 
And the knowledge is eating away at him. 
36 year-old Katash took to Reddit to explain his situation, admitting, "I've been reluctant on bringing it up until the holidays were over and the time has come to spill the beans but I just can't bring myself to it." 
The timing is especially harsh, as their one year anniversary falls in February. 
"I wasn't snooping when I found the messages," he adds. 
"Her Apple devices throughout the house are all linked to her iPhone. Read More Wronged husband gets even and leaves sarcastic instructions "to the man doing my wife" Katash is uncertain of what to do (Photo: Getty) 
"So all of her conversations are just out there. She's not very tech savvy and as far as I can tell has no idea that I know about those linked devices, I'm not sure if she even knows! 
"I needed to use her eight-year-old daughter's iPad to sign out of YouTube because I was sick of seeing kids content on my front page from recently watched lists on my phone. 
"So I got on, I signed out, backed up to the home screen and there was a text message banner that popped up from some guys name." 
There was no mistaking what was going on. Both parties had worked closely together (Photo: Getty) 
"I opened the message and BEHOLD! It's d*** and t**** pictures! 
"There were a few things that she said that were coming from her emotionally, like 'I miss you', 'you give me butterflies when we pass each other', 'I regret dumping you'. Stuff like that. 
"She's a nurse and he's an engaged surgeon. I'm not sure how long they were dating for but I do know it's been a couple years that they've been apart. Not sure if they've gotten physical since then." 
Support for Katash was unanimous. Read More Woman gets VERY mixed advice after checking partner's phone - and finding Plenty of Fish He later added as soon as he found somewhere to stay, he would be leaving (Photo: Getty) 
Several people suggested he leave without an explanation and never look back - as well as getting himself tested. 
"These things are best done promptly," advised one supporter. 
What is perhaps even more concerning though is there's a chance the woman's two young children are able to access the messages. 
Clearly fond of them, it's walking away from them which is also hard. Read More
